alert.note: Alert for Benton; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Marshall, northern Benton, southeastern Fayette and southwestern Hardeman Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 944 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mt Pleasant, or 11 miles northwest of Holly Springs, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lamar, Somerville, Mt Pleasant, Lagrange, Michigan City, Red Banks, Slayden, Warren, Macon, Oakland, Piperton, Rossville, Moscow, Williston, Grand Junction, La Grange, Saulsbury, Cayce, New Canaan and Taska. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
